tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE volunteer_schedule (
    schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    volunteer_id INT,
    task_id INT,
    schedule_date DATE,
    start_time TIME,
    end_time TIME
)

CREATE TABLE Volunteers (
    volunteer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    volunteer_name VARCHAR(50),
    volunteer_email VARCHAR(100),
    volunteer_phone VARCHAR(15)
);

CREATE TABLE Tasks (
    task_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    task_name VARCHAR(50),
    task_description TEXT,
    task_location VARCHAR(100),
    volunteer_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (volunteer_id) REFERENCES Volunteers(volunteer_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Volunteer (
    volunteer_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    contact_number VARCHAR(15),
    address TEXT,
    availability BOOLEAN
);

CREATE TABLE Schedule (
    schedule_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    volunteer_id UUID REFERENCES Volunteer(volunteer_id),
    task_id UUID REFERENCES Task(task_id),
    date DATE,
    start_time TIME,
    end_time TIME
);

CREATE TABLE schedules (
  schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  volunteer_id INT,
  task_id INT,
  schedule_date DATE,
  FOREIGN KEY (volunteer_id) REFERENCES volunteers(id),
  FOREIGN KEY (task_id) REFERENCES tasks(task_id)
);

CREATE TABLE locations (
  location_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  location_name VARCHAR(255),
  address TEXT,
  city VARCHAR(100),
  state VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE assignments (
  assignment_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  volunteer_id INT,
  task_id INT,
  location_id INT,
  assignment_date DATE,
  FOREIGN KEY (volunteer_id) REFERENCES volunteers(id),
  FOREIGN KEY (task_id) REFERENCES tasks(task_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (location_id) REFERENCES locations(location_id)
);
